intro: Pedicularis leptorhiza, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native environment.
